conbody.p: A Target is a network element, management system, virtual network function manager or network function virtualization orchestrator. A Target Group is a logical grouping of targets. Target Groups are then used for granting access to a grouping of network elements, management system, virtual network function manager or network function virtualization orchestrator.

Target Group Management application allows the administrator or operator to perform following operations:
Define a Target Group
Delete a Target Group
Update an existing Target Group

There are two predefined Target Groups:
ALL - Target Group containing all targets.
NONE - Target Group containing no targets.

By default, all users in ENM are assigned roles with predefined Target Group ALL, which means the user has privileges on all targets. It is possible to define a target group for a user to allow user to access to a part of ENM network i.e. to only targets in the associated target groups.
